subject: It's Sunday....
event:
... where are my football games?

Damn.  Even after a SuperBowl victory, the end of the NFL season always leaves you feeling empty.  (And no, I don't count the Pro Bowl as a real football game).

Well, the Draft's not too far off.

Meanwhile, it's back to working seven days a week, I guess.

comments.article: I feel the same way around late May/early June when every single TV show I regularly watch simultaneously ends. Although not this year, thanks to BSG airing later than normal :-)
am in exactly the same place. Why do they even bother with that Hawaiian farce?
and you white people wonder why hawaiians are so mean to tourist.
I asked my father the very same question.  The Arena league starts in a few weeks, but it's just not the same.
My consoling thought is this: Pitchers and catchers report Thursday.
Your statement made me laugh for the most wrong of reasons. XP

comments.subject: That is the consolation going on

comments.article:
Meanwhile, it's back to working seven days a week, I guess.

Damn right! :) Just kidding, of course. Six days a week will be acceptable ;)

Hey, you can always take solace in the fact that they're playing that "I'm goin' to Disney World!" commercial every five minutes, right?
Yeah I wonder around like a headless zombie a couple of Sunday evenings following that game.

Makes me miss the early USFL and spring football.

The first year they even had a snow game.

Too bad Trump tried to take on the NFL.

Yeah, yeah.....back to work.

See you this weekend.


But please, I beg of you, be... gentle.

Ah... sorry, Stego, but Boskone is not on my schedule this year. I made my annual pilgrimage east for the Saratoga WFC, and did my week in NYC after.

However, Howard Waldrop will be there, and H'ard is always a hoot and a half. I'm sure you guys with have a great time.
comments.subject: Boskone

comments.article: theres still hockey :D :P

comments.upictitle: Jenna: Sugar and spice and all that
comments.article:
Yay! Exactly!

(My Pens are doing well, my poor 'nucks are not.)

comments.upictitle: Jeanne / Xaviara al'Nady / Tita Kini: PolarBear
comments.article: There's always baseball ;-)

comments.upictitle: Jenna: Sugar and spice and all that
comments.article: There's always hockey!
I already miss football so much I'm kicking around giving www.allamericanfootballleague.com a chance.
comments.subject: I share your pain...

comments.article: Look at it this way -- the Giants are still NFL champions, and will be for at least another year!
I am trying to hold off on thinking about the Draft at least until the combine. At least I have the primaries to keep me occupied.

This is why I love the two sports that I love.

Baseball season starts in March. Stanley Cup race is in April.

Puck drops in October. Pennant race starts in..October.

I'm never without something to watch at the sports bar. :)

comments.upictitle: space_geek_ken: river blond black shirt ken
comments.article: The nice thing about working as a writer is that you only have to work half days, and you get to pick which twelve hours of the day count...
We have *so* got to get you into baseball.

comments.upictitle: The Greatest Fucking Genius of All Time: villain
comments.article: The Pro Bowl was an interesting game this year, though.  Didn't expect the NFC to pull it out, but then they ran away with it!

comments.upictitle: Thoughts of a nerdy feminist: Killstark
comments.article: Well, I don't relate at all on the football thing (It's not even allowed on in my home!), but that is the same feeling I get after I finish a good book.  I feel a bit sad and empty after it's over.

I miss Football after the Superbowl myself. At least I have Free Agency and the Draft to look forward to. Not to mention I can now turn the NFL channel off. I watch it so much during football season that I don't get as much work done as I should.
comments.subject: I agree...

comments.article:
Yeah. I felt the same way. Spent most of the day trying to fill the emptiness with hours of political pundits on all their Sunday morning shows. I think my brain is developing cavities. To compound the problem, I finished A Feast for Crows this week. I don't expect to see the next installment of that until next Fall either.

*shrugs*

I guess there's always baseball, eh?

Reminds me of the time I finished this awesome book you may have heard of, A Feast for Crows. . .

;)

Yes! No more football! Now we can finally get that finished version of Dance with Dragons!

Hehe, I'm just kidding. The super bowl was the only game I got the see this year (I have to work every sunday), but I was glad to see your Giants win. I'm hoping the good kharma will continue to flow and the joy you feel now will soon be my joy at reading a new Jon Snow chapter. :-p
Well, I grew up, and still live, in Daytona Beach. So I'm happy to see the return of NASCAR. :)
Time for college basketball!  March Madness right around the corner!
